meanings.definition: To stay in a place longer than necessary.
meanings.sent1: After school, I always linger in the library to finish my homework.
meanings.sent2: She tends to linger at the park after everyone else has gone home.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was so delicious that I couldn't help but linger over every bite.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood would linger in her mind like a sweet melody.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies lingered in the kitchen, tempting everyone.

meanings.definition: To remain in a place longer than expected.
meanings.sent1: The guests decided to linger at the party even after it was officially over.
meanings.sent2: He would often linger in the office, working late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The cat would linger by the fish tank, hoping for a chance to catch a glimpse of the fish.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of excitement lingered in the air long after the surprise announcement.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun lingered on her skin, reminding her of lazy summer days.

meanings.definition: To be slow in leaving a place.
meanings.sent1: The old man would always linger at the park, enjoying the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: She would linger by the door, hesitant to step outside into the storm.
meanings.sent3: The scent of fresh flowers made her linger in the garden longer than planned.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music lingered in the room, creating a soothing ambiance.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the dessert lingered on her tongue, making her crave more.
